page.title: 18FIRE SERVICE
page.content:
A volunteer Fire Brigade was formed in Kineton by{Lord Willoughby de Broke * in 1885. The centenary fete, this year,was opened by his grandson David.
Today Kineton is in the Leamington Division of the County Fire and Rescue Service and is a part-time retained station manned by 2 full-time officers (for day-time cover) and 11 fireman. The Station Officer is also responsible for fire precautions in the area. The engine is a general purpose water tender which carries 1800 litres and general fire-fighting equipment Over recent years the appliance has been called out an average 100 times a year. { * Willoughby de Broke's}owned much of the land around Kineton until the 1960s.
